subject: Photography
title: Soft Light: Gentle Gradients
description: A 60-second lesson on Soft Light: Gentle Gradients.

hook.text: Soft light wraps around subjects like a blanket. Shadows fade gently. Everything looks smoother.

buildup.text: Soft light comes from large sources relative to the subject â€” overcast skies, big windows, studio softboxes.

discovery.text: Shadow edges are gradual, not sharp. Tones transition smoothly. Skin looks even and textures are minimized.

twist.text: Making light softer is simple: make the source bigger or bring it closer. Distance hardens; proximity softens.

climax.text: Soft light is the default for beauty, food, and product photography. It flatters almost everything.

punchline.text: Want softer light? Get a bigger source. Or get closer.

quiz.question: How do you make a light source produce softer light?
options: Make it larger relative to the subject or move it closer
